result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy K. Oxberger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.  (Court has ordered that the costs owed by the Defendant in this case be removed from cash bond that had been posted on the Defendant's behalf in other matters that were dismissed and read in at the time of sentencing.  When Defendant signs up for probation, he may not owed anything to DOC other than supervision fees.  Refer to the Assessment Report for details on what, if any, costs are owed.)

Pay restitution within the first 30 days of probation - $15.83 to Thrifty White.  (This has been ordered accomplished from application of bail bond monies in dismissed/read-in cases, same as the other costs owed).  

Counsel stipulate to 3 days credit in the event of revocation.
Concurrent with: 14CM84

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy K. Oxberger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: info requested and sent to Dane Co DA's office

3 cases called together:  15CM73 and 15CF6 for adjourned initial; 14CM84 for status.  Defendant Jeremy K. Oxberger in court with attorney Mark W. Frank. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.

15CF6 initial conducted - rights stated; def waives prelim time limits and asks for status scheduling.  Colloquy re time limits waiver.

15CM73 initial conducted.

Status held in 14CM84.

In misdemeanor matters, def stands mute for entry of NG plea.

Status requested and set for all 3 cases.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Letter from Atty asking for the 2 court dates be put on for the same date.

15CF6/adjourned initial and 14CM84/status.  Defendant Jeremy K. Oxberger in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. M states def wants her to withdraw as he has Atty. Mark Frank in other matters and wants him as counsel in these matters as well.  Court will allow Atty. M's withdrawal and sets these matters for July 15 at 10.  Notice to go directly to def as def will still need to have Atty. Frank formally appointed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jeremy K. Oxberger in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  15CF6/adjourned initial and 14CF84/status.  Counsel ask for setover to May 27 at 10.  First, Court completes the initial in 15CF6.  Atty. M states Defense has received the complaint.  DA states charges - felony bail jumping, mis. bail jumping, mis. theft of movable property.  Court states possible max. penalties.

Atty. M asks for status scheduling - not prelim.  Court sets 15CF6 again as adjourned initial as a reminder that the prelim has not been done.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jeremy K. Oxberger in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  AIA in 15CF6 and status in 14CF84.  Atty. M asks that these matters be adj. to April 1.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jeremy K. Oxberger in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received.  Def waives formal reading.  Court states charges and possible max. penalties as well as rights including right to counsel.  DA notes def has Atty. McDougal in another case; suggests this be adj. to then as well.  Court instructs the def that he still needs to call SPD for counsel appointment.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.
